cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI 

Reasoning: The paper discusses the use of fuzzy techniques in natural language generation, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper explores the relationship between different tasks involved in the NLG system pipeline architecture, which is a topic that falls under the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of fuzzy sets in linguistic summarization of data, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper references recent work in the context of cross-fertilization of research fields, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
